Notes: Single-seat variant with AN/APG-73(V) AESA radar (150 km detection), 6-8 AIM-120C-7 loads, and LANTIRN pods for precision BVR; HEP II upgrades (IOC 2025) enhance ECCM and datalink for NORAD E-3 cueing to 120 km envelope; 4 Wing Cold Lake / 3 Wing Bagotville, backbone of QRA/NATO ops until F-35 transition.

Two-seat variant with identical AN/APG-73(V) radar and 4-6 AIM-120C-7 missiles for tactics training and operational BVR; supports two-ship formations and ELINT fusion; integrated with CP-140 for maritime targeting, extending effective range in Arctic/Pacific theaters.

Ex-RAAF single-seat interim fighters with HUG 3.2 upgrades (AN/APG-73 radar, AIM-120C-7 compatibility); bridges CF-18 life extension to 2032; 425 Squadron at Bagotville, bolstering fleet volume for high-sortie BVR in NORAD commitments.
Ex-RAAF two-seat trainers with HUG 3.2 avionics for BVR mission rehearsal; supports squadron surge and datalink interoperability; acquired 2019-2022 to maintain readiness amid F-35 delays.

P-3 Orion derivative with AN/APS-134 radar (300 km horizon) for off-board air/missile cueing and sonobuoy drops; Block II upgrades (2025) add Link-16 for BVR support to CF-18; 14 Wing Greenwood / 19 Wing Comox, vital for Atlantic/Pacific surveillance until P-8A replacement (first 2027).

Electro-optical ISR platform with EO/IR turrets (100+ km slant-range) for real-time targeting feeds to Hornets via SATCOM/Link-16; 434 Squadron at Trenton, enhances ground/AEW gap-filling for 120 km networked engagements.

Legacy tanker/SAR variant with probe refueling for 1.5+ hour BVR extensions on CF-18; 435/436 Squadrons at Trenton/Greenwood; modernized avionics (2025) for austere basing, supporting rapid deployment in Arctic ops.
A310-based MRTT with hose/drogue pods for long-range refueling, enabling sustained BVR patrols; 437 Squadron at Trenton; 2 tankers +1 VIP, bridging to CC-330 fleet (3 operational, 6 more by 2027).
